medical_history.chief_complaint: Febrile neutropenia with a painful lower-limb ulcer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The painful lower-limb ulcer had been present for approximately 5 months prior to her presentation. The patient has longstanding neutropenia, first diagnosed approximately 30 years prior, and has had two recent presentations with respiratory sepsis. A similar necrotic wound and cellulitis of her right breast were managed recently, healing with antibiotic therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP)-positive rheumatoid arthritis complicated by Felty's syndrome. Longstanding neutropenia diagnosed approximately 30 years prior. Background of type 2 diabetes mellitus, Hashimoto thyroiditis, obesity, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and poor mobility.
